main: ^Wow, this is amazing Aunty, a bit spicy but I love it. I need to know how you make this.
^Before I give it to you, do you know the history of a bunny chow?
^No I don’t, Aunty. It is a bit of a weird name, when I first heard it I thought we would be eating rabbits.

^There are a few tales about that name. Some say it was created by Indian immigrants in Durban who used to serve curry in hollowed-out bread loaves to labourers. The word "bunny" might be derived from the Indian term "bania," meaning a trader. But to be honest, nobody's entirely sure. It's just one of those South African mysteries.
^Well that means food, or to eat.
